ul.li1: 131 A wise child hears the discipline of a father,
ul.li2: but a scoffer does not listen to a rebuke.
ul.li1: 2From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he shall eat what is good,
ul.li2: but the desireOr “soul” of the treacherous, wrongdoing.
ul.li1: 3He who keeps his mouth guards his life;Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: he who opens his lips, ruin belongs to him.
ul.li1: 4The soulOr “life” of the lazy craves, but there is nothing,
ul.li2: but the person of diligence is richly supplied.
ul.li1: 5The righteous hates a word of falsehood;
ul.li2: the wicked will bring shame and disgrace.Literally “he will bring disgrace”
ul.li1: 6Righteousness will guard the upright of way,
ul.li2: but wickedness will overthrow sin.
ul.li1: 7There is one who acts rich but has nothing;Literally “there is no”
ul.li2: another who pretends to be poor but has wealth.
ul.li1: 8The ransom of the life of a man is his wealth,
ul.li2: but the poor does not receive a threat.
ul.li1: 9The light of the righteous will rejoice,
ul.li2: but the lamp of the wicked will die out.
ul.li1: 10Only by insolence is strife set up,
ul.li2: and wisdom is with those who take advice.
ul.li1: 11Wealth gained from hasteOr “vanity” will dwindle,
ul.li2: but he who gathers little by littleLiterally “upon the hand” will increase it.
ul.li1: 12Hope that is deferred makes the heartOr “mind” sick,
ul.li2: but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
ul.li1: 13He who despises a word will bring destruction on himself,
ul.li2: but he who respects a commandment will be rewarded.
ul.li1: 14The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
ul.li2: in order to avoid the snares of death.
ul.li1: 15Good sense grants favor,
ul.li2: but the way of the faithless is coarse.
ul.li1: 16Anyone who is clever will act with intelligence,
ul.li2: but the fool will display folly.
ul.li1: 17A messenger of wickedness will fall into trouble,
ul.li2: but an envoy of the faithful brings healing.
ul.li1: 18Poverty and disgrace belong to him who ignores instruction,
ul.li2: but he who guards reproof will be honored.
ul.li1: 19A desire fulfilledLiterally “made to be,” “brought about” will be sweet to the soul,
ul.li2: but an abomination of fools is turning from evil.
ul.li1: 20Walk with the wise and be wise,
ul.li2: but as for the companion of fools, he will suffer harm.
ul.li1: 21Misfortune will pursue sinners,
ul.li2: but the righteous will be rewarded with prosperity.Literally “it will reward prosperity”
ul.li1: 22He who is good will leave an inheritance to his grandchildren,Literally “sons of sons”
ul.li2: and stored up for the righteous is the wealth of a sinner.
ul.li1: 23There is much food in the field of the poor,
ul.li2: but it is swept awayLiterally “there is sweeping away” by injustice.Literally “no justice”
ul.li1: 24He who withholds his rod hates his child,
ul.li2: but he who loves him gives himLiterally “visits him” discipline.
ul.li1: 25The righteous eats to satisfy his life,Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: but the belly of the wicked will lack.
